sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The World Health Organization warns of a tsunami of coronavirus cases due to the Delta and Omicron variants as European countries continue to break records.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: France registered an EU all-time high of 208,000 new infections on Wednesday, with the US logging almost half a million cases.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Recent Christmas gatherings are likely behind the surge and authorities are warning about the upcoming New Year celebrations with Germany canceling large-scale parties and limiting private gatherings to 10 people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I therefore appeal the population to be very cautious during the days of the turn of the year so that we do not allow any additional infection chains in the first place or interrupt them. Please celebrate in very small groups and do not endanger each other, because the current reported incidence of cases underestimates the danger we are currently in.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, the Vienna Philharmonic has confirmed that its world-famous New Year concert will have a live audience, although it will be limited to just a thousand people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Last year there was no audience at all.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I think we are very lucky that we can do this with one thousand people, because music has to be enjoyed live. The fact that we have 92 countries, I think, watching is a wonderful gesture towards the orchestra and towards the music, but basically it has to be with public, with live public.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And I think that this will be very special in these difficult times.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Not the best scenario for the maestro, who nevertheless says the most important fact is that the music will go on in Vienna's famous, golden Musikverein concert hall.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: People queued again in front of cinemas and theatres in Belgium after authorities confirmed the reopening of cultural venues after a brief shutdown.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The reversal came after a top court ruled that the initial measures weren't proportionate and singled out the industry.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We're thrilled that we resisted and we won the fight that we started.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We did this because we were disgusted that they hit on culture like that and we didn't feel like we were putting our spectators at risk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: So we really are delighted to be allowed to legally open.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: After an initial shutdown last week aimed at curbing the spread of the Omicron variant, cultural venues can now open to a maximum of 200 people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Wearing face masks and having a health pass will be mandatory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We felt that this was an unfair decision, so of course we're pleased that it's been rectified.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: On the other hand, the past few days have of course been a real roller coaster.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It's not like you can just switch the lights back on and open the doors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It takes some preparation." Thousands protested against the shutdown last weekend, calling it extremely unfair as bars and restaurants were allowed to keep working.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Many in the industry will now welcome the change to go back to work.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The first Covid self-test kits have arrived on the shelves of French supermarkets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: This comes as health officials registered more than 202,000 cases across the country on Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: More than double the numbers recorded on Christmas Day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In a bid to tackle the surge of the highly contagious Omicron variant, rapid antigen tests provide one more tool to combat Covid-19.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's less time consuming than queuing up for PCR tests. I don't know if it's reliable or not but maybe at least it gives us an idea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Across the channel, a shortage of lateral flow tests in English pharmacies is causing widespread anxiety. Frustrated locals are now flocking to get PCR tests to ensure they are virus free for New Year's celebrations but also for work.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We went to pick some up and there's none in the pharmacies around my way. There's none, they've all got the signs up saying they've run out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Moving south to Italy, the high demand for self-tests combined with supply chain issues has resulted in a bottleneck as Italians experience long waits to get tested.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Even getting a rapid test has become more difficult than before.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: This is one of the many testing sites in the capital, Rome, where people have to queue for hours sometimes they have to wait up until eight hours before they can get tested and most of these people are not people who have to board a plane and need a certification these people are people who just want to check whether or not they've got covet but if on the one hand the situation here in rome seems to be under control people, they have to queue for hours but they will eventually get tested. In northern Italy, in Milan, some of these testing locations have been overbooked and people were simply told that they could not get tested and the army has been deployed to help with testing procedures. Georgia Orlandi, Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: testing procedures. Georgia Orlandi, Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Well here in the UK at hospitals like this one in West London there's a fear of being overwhelmed with 10,000 people now in hospitals across the UK and a shortage of National Health Service staff as well because of sickness or being told to isolate. We are hearing that hospital hubs are due to open in the new year when cases are expected to rise.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But also there's a shortage of tests here, a shortage of home tests, lateral flow tests, and PCR tests as well.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The supply has been patchy for some time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The government is promising another 8 million tests before New Year's Eve, and that, of course, is tomorrow night.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And there is confusion about some of the rules here because England's rules for example are more lenient than those of the devolved nations which many fear could mean that tomorrow night when revelers want to celebrate New Year's Eve they could cross the border from countries like Wales and Scotland into England that could of course mean and more transmission of the disease and it's also bad news for hospitality in the devolved nations who will lose their customers to English pubs, restaurants etc. And this confusion is leading to an uptick in protests by anti-vaxxers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: There was a big protest yesterday north of London in Milton Keynes where protesters stormed a centre. They thought it was a vaccination centre. They were mistaken. It was a test and trace centre but that didn't stop them from vandalising and stealing some supplies inside the centre. So Boris Johnson has a big job on his hands to reassure people and to reassure hospitals like this one that he and the government are doing all they can this year ahead of a potential difficult few months in the new year. Ghislaine Maxwell, the former partner of financier

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, has been found guilty on five of six counts for her role in recruiting and grooming Epstein's teenage victims, some of them as young as 14.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Maxwell's lawyer says they are already working on the appeal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We firmly believe in Ghislaine's innocence. Obviously, we are very disappointed with the verdict. We have already started working on the appeal, and we are confident that she will be vindicated. After a month-long trial, Maxwell will face sentences ranging from five to 40 years in prison for each of the five charges for which she was found guilty.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: This is a victory for all of the victims of Ms. Maxwell and Epstein. Moreover, I think this is a victory for all young children, boys, girls, women and men who are victims of abusers like this.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It will give them the needed push to step forward and to speak their truth and to hopefully get justice like these young girls have with respect to Ms. Maxwell.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Epstein died in 2019 while awaiting federal trial for sex trafficking and conspiracy charges.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: He was accused of paying girls under the age of 18 to perform sex acts between 2002 and 2005 in a case that involved several high-profile politicians and celebrities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Nord Stream 2, the $11 billion pipeline connecting Germany directly with Russian gas, is ready for operation, according to Russian President Vladimir Putin, although it still requires approval from Germany and the EU.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Officials say a decision on the matter won't come in the first half of 2022.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The project is hugely controversial, with critics in the US, Ukraine and Poland warning that it will increase Russia's leverage over EU states. Moscow has denied ulterior motives, saying the project is purely commercial, helping to ensure long-term supply and saving billions in transit fees paid to Poland and Ukraine. President Putin also argued it would drive prices down, particularly alluring as European gas and electric prices have soared since the summer.
